meanings.definition: Goods that have deteriorated or become unfit for use.
meanings.sent1: The spoilages in the fridge had a foul smell.
meanings.sent2: The grocery store had to throw out the spoilages to maintain quality.
meanings.sent3: The picnic was ruined by the spoilages in the cooler.
meanings.sent4: The spoilages in the pantry were a sad reminder of neglect.
meanings.sent5: The sight and smell of the spoilages made everyone cringe.

meanings.definition: The act of spoiling or the condition of being spoiled.
meanings.sent1: The spoilages of the milk were evident from its sour taste.
meanings.sent2: Leaving food out in the sun can lead to spoilages.
meanings.sent3: The spoilages of the surprise party were accidentally revealed.
meanings.sent4: The spoilages of trust can be hard to repair.
meanings.sent5: The spoilages of time left their mark on the old book.
